Key Match Events: Ireland Men’s hopes of reaching the 2024 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup Super 8s hang in the balance after a 12-run loss to Canada in New York.
George Dockrell (30*) and Mark Adair (34) battled their side back into contention with a 62-run stand for the seventh-wicket.
Jeremy Gordon held his nerve with the ball in the final over, preventing Ireland from reaching their target.
Mark Adair picked up the wicket of Navneet Dhaliwal in just the third over of the match.
Craig Young struck twice in quick succession before Gareth Delany pulled off a superb caught-and-bowled with his very first delivery.
Nicholas Kirton (49) and Shreyas Movva (37) formed an excellent 75-run fifth-wicket partnership.
Barry McCarthy picked up two wickets in the penultimate over, which went for just two runs.
Barry McCarthy ran out Shreyas Movva on the final ball of the innings.
Canada closed on 137-7 from their 20 overs.
Ireland openers Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie made a steady start but were dismissed for nine and 17, respectively.
Harry Tector was dismissed for seven.
Lorcan Tucker was run-out with the score at 50-4.
Curtis Campher was superbly caught in the deep by Aaron Johnson.
Jeremy Gordon bowled a dot ball first up in the final over, then dismissed Mark Adair for 34.
Canada picked up their first ever World Cup win.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland captain Paul Stirling would have been delighted to call right at the toss and put the opposition into bat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland now need to win both of their final two matches in Group A to stand any chance of progressing to the knockout stages.
Ireland will play their final two fixtures in Group A against co-hosts USA on Friday, 14 June and Pakistan two days later at Central Broward Park.
